thread.title: Lorries flipped and trees torn down: Shock pics of Storm Doris carnage emerge
thread.title_full: Lorries flipped and trees torn down: Shock pics of Storm Doris carnage emerge

title: Lorries flipped and trees torn down: Shock pics of Storm Doris carnage emerge
text:
“It is strengthening as it moves eastwards to the UK” Met Office forecaster 
Soldiers have been placed on standby to rescue Brits caught up in the weather bomb caused by the storm as snow, floods and strong winds smack the UK. 
In one street a trampoline was pictured careering it’s way down a street smashing into parked cars in Ireland. 
An overturned lorry at Louth in Lincolnshire caused traffic chaos on the Drogheda Bridge northbound required emergency assistance. 
Airports are cancelling flights due to the dangers of strong winds and commuters are struggling on public transport. 
Heavy snow is blanketing parts of Scotland as many roads in Ireland are blocked due to falling trees. 
DUBLIN FIRE BLOCKED: Roads have been closed in Dublin, Ireland, near Malahide Castle 
TWITTER CARNAGE: Trees are being brought down all around the country 
SG SNOW: Some areas in Scotland are being blanketed in snow Storm Angus: Britain floods Tuesday, 22nd November 2016 Storm Angus has brought hurricane force winds to southern Britain causing flooding and power cuts to thousands of homes. 1 / 23 
Southern Rail commuters have been warned to expect further delays and cancellations as gale-force winds cause havoc on the train lines. 
Network Rail have issued speed restrictions throughout today to “limit the risks to passengers and staff”. 
Weather warnings have been upgraded to amber across Scotland's central belt, the Borders, Dumfries and Galloway, Tayside and Fife. 
"We have got a fairly active area of low pressure coming in from the Atlantic," said Met Office forecaster Emma Sharples. 
INSTAGRAM COLD: Snow is blanketing the station at Croy in Scotland 
ITV GUSTS: Winds of up to 90mph are expected in many parts of the UK 
TWITTER GALES: Strong winds have turned over trampolines 
PA TRAVEL MAYHEM: Snow falls on the motorway in Falkirk in Scotland 
"It is strengthening as it moves eastwards to the UK." 
The Severn Crossing M48 has been closed to high sided vehicles as powerful gusts of wind threaten to sweep lorries over. Related articles
